definition: variegated/heterogeneous/to refute/to contradict/to ship by barge/a barge/a lighter (ship)

sentences.english: Now we are going to unload the beet pulp pellet overside into the barges.
sentences.chinese: 現在我們要把外檔的甜菜渣卸到駁船上。

sentences.english: When the barge reached the shrine, acolytes removed the pall.
sentences.chinese: 當駁船抵達聖地時，輔祭除去了柩衣。

sentences.english: It’s dusk and that part of the river’s just mud and an old barge.
sentences.chinese: 天已經黃昏，而那裏除了泥巴外，只有一條老駁船。

sentences.english: Mules and horses on land pulled the barges through the canal using ropes.
sentences.chinese: 騾和馬在岸上用繩索牽拉着駁船在運河中前行。

sentences.english: In the scow , the cowering fowl scowled at the howling owl.
sentences.chinese: 在平底駁船裏，畏縮的家禽對嚎叫的貓頭鷹面露不悅。

sentences.english: The larger question is whether Google will actually deploy these data center barges. Rich Miller at Data Center Knowledge writes
sentences.chinese: 更大的問題是谷歌是否會實際部署這些數據中心駁船。

sentences.english: I wouldn't touch it with a barge pole.
sentences.chinese: 我用一根駁船撐杆也夠不到它。

sentences.english: We should have the dredge, barges and draglines in place about the same time.
sentences.chinese: 差不多要在同時使挖泥機，駁船和索鬥鏟各就各位。

sentences.english: Ore and coal had been barged down the Ohio to the Mississippi.
sentences.chinese: 礦砂和煤已被用駁船沿俄亥俄河運載到密西西比河。

sentences.english: They have a barge that sits about two, three miles off.
sentences.chinese: 離那裏兩三英里有一條駁船。

sentences.english: They are unloading an oil barge.
sentences.chinese: 他們正在從運油駁船卸貨。

sentences.english: The cargo is being discharged into lighters.
A towboat pushes barges down the flood-swollen Mississippi River at Memphis, Tenn.
sentences.chinese: 一艘拖輪在孟斐斯的密西西比河上拖着駁船前進。

sentences.english: This barge transported them to the Ophideraan.
sentences.chinese: 這艘駁船把他倆送到奧菲德朗。

sentences.english: While the ship going alongside Gaoyang Wharf, two barges were drifting towards her.
sentences.chinese: 該輪正在靠泊高陽碼頭時，突遇漂近來的兩艘駁船。

sentences.english: I’ve got to run. Another barge is passing by.
sentences.chinese: 我得跑步了，又有一艘駁船過來了。

definition: (of a ship) to strike a reef/(fig.) to hit a snag
to construct by hoisting ready-built components into place
